poem:
**Hymn of the Cathode**

The ghosts in the box
rattle chains of light,
drawing from my throat
words sharp as a sickle.
I stand, alone, in this dim
room, our modern
cathedral of flickers,
testifying against
the flicker of lives
not mine, as if
they could hear,
as if it mattered.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "As a TV critic, maybe I should try to stop shouting at the telly Lately, I’ve been doing something of which I’m genuinely ashamed. I take everything on-screen personally now. “You’re being immature!” I’ll accuse the protagonists of teen drama Euphoria. “Hell of a job you did with those". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
